page.title: 09THE WILLOWS,RYTON,GATESHEAD.
page.content: We walked through steeply sloping woodland to get to the{Willows. A railway line runs along the bottom of this hill although there is no longer a station in Ryton.The line runs from{Newcastle}to{Carlise.}There are two ponds on this side of the railway line where people fish. One of these is the{Curling Pond.}The game of {Curling Stones}used to be played when the river was frozen over. Through the arch under the railway line brings you out to the flat expanse of Ryton Willows leading down to the riverside. There is another pond on the Willows. The ground is covered with gorse.The local heritage group planted trees to help enhance the view towards the power station. Walking towards{Newburn Bridge}we pass the pond, the old rugby and football pitch and farmers fields. continued....
